main event: A round ball of light that appeared about the size of a grapefruit was observed in the north-northwest sky in Worland, Wyoming.
interesting points: The light had a pulsing or flashing effect.
The light appeared stationary at times.
The object was observed for about 5 minutes.
A family in Worland reported launching nine hot air balloons the previous evening, which may explain the observed object.
The report includes a map of Worland and the surrounding area, as well as a map of the First National Bank area.
